title: Update the Service Catalog
content:
You edit the Service Catalog in the Service Catalog Management module.

Service categories

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Service Catalog > Catalog.

  2. To edit a catalog category, select the category, click the down arrow, and select Edit.

    The General tab displays the following sections:

    Section Description
    Category details

    Includes the following fields:

    • Display label

    • Description
    Audience

    Used to specify the appropriate audiences. This entitles users in the selected audiences, defined by location and user group, to access the category in the Service Portal.

    Audiences are defined in Administration > Master Data > People > Entitlement Rules. For more information, see How to manage entitlement rules.
    Category display settings Fields used to design category tiles for the Service Portal. For more information, see How to design category tiles for the Service Portal.
    Preview Displays a preview of the category tile.

  3. To delete a category, select the category, click the down arrow, and select Delete.

    You can't delete a category that contains services. Before deleting a category, transfer any services under that category to other categories.

Service Definitions

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Service Catalog > Catalog.

  2. Click a catalog. The service definitions in the catalog are displayed under Service Definition.
  3. Select a service definition.

    Tip Enter a text string in the filter box to narrow down the list of services displayed in the Service Definition pane.

  4. Click the down arrow, and select Edit. For more information about the service definition fields, see How to create a service definition record.

You can't delete a service definition from a category. You can move the service definition to another category, or decommission the service definition.

If a service definition is decommissioned, both the service definition and its offerings aren't available in the Service Portal, and none of its offerings are displayed in the Service Request Management module.

For more information about the Services workflow, see Service component workflow.

Offerings

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Service Catalog.
  2. Under Catalog, click a catalog. Its services are displayed under Service Definition.
  3. Under Service Definition, click a service definition. Its offerings are displayed under Offerings.
  4. To add an offering, click Add.

    Note: If your tenant admin has enabled aggregation in Application Settings, to add an offering, click Add, and then click Add an offering or Add an aggregated offering.

    To edit an offering, select the offering, click  , and then select Edit.

    For more information, see How to create an offering.

  • Offering types

    A pink line on the left of the offering indicates a support offering.

    A dark green line on the left of the offering indicates a service offering.

  • Filter the list of offerings

    • Enter a text string in the filter box.
    • Select All/Active/Inactive to display the offerings with the selected status only.
    • Select All/Support Offerings/Service Offerings to display the selected type of offering only.

  • Change an offering's status

    • Activating an offering makes it available in the Service Portal and in the Service Request Management module.

      An active offering is indicated by a checkmark icon:

      The offering is displayed in the Service Portal only if its parent service is at the operational metaphase of its workflow.

    • Deactivating an offering makes it unavailable in the Service Portal and the Service Request Management module, but doesn't delete it from the Service Catalog.

    You can't delete an offering. To delete an offering from a service, move the offering to a different service.
